newsitem.title: UK: Iran buys cargo of white sugar for April -traders.
newsitem.headline: Iran buys cargo of white sugar for April -traders.

text.p: Iran's state-run Government Trading Corporation (GTC) bought a cargo of white sugar at $314.00 per tonne for shipment in April, London traders said on Tuesday.
Details of the supplier have yet to emerge.
Last week the GTC bought 30,000 tonnes of Cuban raws for March/May shipment and 14,000 tonnes of European Union white sugar, again for April.
Prices paid were reported to be $269.00 per tonne for the raws and $313.00 for the whites, although one trader cited a price of $313.50.
